column5: The strange inscription on this tombstone reads “Lilly E. Gray, Victim of the Beast 666.”

column1: But it’s unclear which is stranger–the inscription or the fact that no one seems to know what it means or why it was placed here.

It seems inherently mean-spririted, yet everything else about the grave marker seems lovingly planned and cared for. It has been more than half a century since Lilly died, if that is indeed her name, and the mystery of the meaning behind the inscription endures.
column2: Here lies Lilly E. Gray, an alleged "Victim of the Beast," but no one knows why.
column3: ['Anderson Tower Monument', 'Gilgal Sculpture Garden', 'The Pioneer Memorial Museum']
